IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SEE SCHEDULE O FOR THE DETAILED MISSION DESCRIPTION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO BE A CHARITABLE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT IMPROVES THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN OUR COMMUNITIES THROUGH PROGRAMS AND SERVICES THAT STRENGTHEN THE SPIRIT, MIND, AND BODY FOR ALL.(CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O)
IRS990.Desc: OUR YMCA PROGRAMS, SUCH AS THOSE DESCRIBED BELOW, OFFER A RANGE OF EXPERIENCES THAT ENRICH COGNITIVE, SOCIAL, PHYSICAL, AND EMOTIONAL GROWTH.CHILD CARE: THE VALPARAISO FAMILY YMCA SEEKS TO PROVIDE ACCESSIBLE, HIGH QUALITY, COMPREHENSIVE CARE AND EDUCATION FOR A DIVERSE COMMUNITY IN A SAFE, NURTURING ENVIRONMENT. WE BELIEVE A PARTNERSHIP OF CHILD, PARENT, AND DEDICATED STAFF SUPPORTS CHILDREN IN OUR CARE TO BECOME RESPONSIBLE, RESPECTFUL AND CARING INDIVIDUALS. THE PARTNERSHIP STRIVES TO NOURISH THE CHILDREN'S PHYSICAL, INTELLECTUAL, EMOTIONAL AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT BY PROVIDING WELL-ROUNDED, FUN, CREATIVE AND ENRICHING PROGRAMS AND EXPERIENCES. (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O)

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 12, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EFFECTIVE DECEMBER 1, 2009, THE ORGANIZATION ADOPTED THE ACCOUNTING POLICY TO RECOGNIZE A TAX BENEFIT ONLY IF IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THE TAX POSITION WOULD BE SUSTAINED IN A TAX EXAMINATION, WITH A TAX EXAMINATION BEING PRESUMED TO OCCUR. THE AMOUNT RECOGNIZED WILL BE THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF TAX BENEFIT THAT IS GREATER THAN 50% LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED ON EXAMINATION. FOR TAX POSITIONS NOT MEETING THE MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT TEST, NO TAX BENEFIT WILL BE RECORDED.
INVESTMENT AND OTHER INCOME LOSS OF FOUNDATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 1 - ORGANIZATION'S MISSION
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OUR CAUSE: THE Y HELPS ALL PEOPLE - REGARDLESS OF AGE, INCOME OR BACKGROUND - DEVELOP THE SKILLS AND RELATIONSHIPS THEY NEED TO BE HEALTHY, CONFIDENT AND CONNECTED TO OTHERS. THE VALPARAISO FAMILY YMCA IS A CAUSE-DRIVEN CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION THAT BRINGS PEOPLE TOGETHER - MEMBERS, VOLUNTEERS, AND COMMUNITY LEADERS -TO BRING ABOUT MEANINGFUL CHANGE BY DEVELOPING THE POTENTIAL OF KIDS, IMPROVING HEALTH AND WELL-BEING, AND GIVING BACK AND SUPPORTING OUR NEIGHBORHOODS. FOR 76 YEARS, OUR NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION HAS BEEN GIVING PEOPLE OF ALL AGES AND BACKGROUNDS THE TOOLS AND SUPPORT THEY NEED TO LEARN, GROW AND THRIVE. WITH TWO MAIN CENTERS AND PROGRAM LOCATIONS WITHIN PORTER COUNTY, THE VALPARAISO FAMILY YMCA REACHES OVER 24000 LIVES - 1 IN EVERY 7 PEOPLE IN THE PORTER COUNTY AREA IT SERVES. BY NURTURING THE POTENTIAL OF CHILDREN AND TEENS, IMPROVING THE COMMUNITY'S HEALTH AND WELL-BEING AND PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO SERVE OTHERS AND SUPPORT OUR NEIGHBORS. THROUGH A RANGE OF QUALITY OUTCOME-BASED PROGRAMS, SERVICES, PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATIONS, THE ORGANIZATION OFFERS HOPE THROUGHOUT PORTER COUNTY BY INSPIRING YOUTH, IMPROVING HEALTH, SERVING OTHERS, AND CREATING COMMUNITY. THE ORGANIZATION STRIVES TO MODEL AND TEACH THE YMCA'S CORE CHARACTER VALUES OF CARING, HONESTY, RESPECT, AND RESPONSIBILITY. OUR VISION STATEMENT: WE ARE FOR YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, HEALTHY LIVING AND SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY. OUR VISION IS TO OFFER HOPE FOR LIFE TO PEOPLE OF ALL AGES, FAITHS, RACES, BACKGROUNDS AND ABILITIES, REGARDLESS OF THEIR SOCIOECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCE. THROUGH A RANGE OF QUALITY OUTCOME-BASED PROGRAMS, SERVICES, PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATIONS, WE OFFER HOPE THROUGHOUT PORTER COUNTY BY INSPIRING YOUTH, IMPROVING HEALTH, SERVING OTHERS AND CREATING COMMUNITY. IN ALL THAT WE DO, WE STRIVE TO MODEL AND TEACH THE YMCA'S CORE CHARACTER VALUES OF CARING, HONESTY,RESPECT AND RESPONSIBILITY. WE BELIEVE THAT EVERYONE DESERVES A CHANCE TO WORK TOWARD REACHING THEIR FULL POTENTIAL. WE BELIEVE THAT LASTING PERSONAL AND SOCIAL CHANGE CAN ONLY COME ABOUT WHEN WE ALL WORK TOGETHER. THANKS TO OUR COMMUNITY'S GENEROUS SUPPORT OF OUR ANNUAL CAMPAIGN, OUR Y REMAINS AVAILABLE TO ALL.

IN 2022, OVER 700 CHILDREN ATTENDED CHILDCARE PROGRAMS AND WE SUBSIDIZED A TOTAL OF $134,684. DURING 2022, OUR CHILDCARE PROGRAMS: *UTILIZED A RICH CURRICULUM TO HELP KIDS BUILD A STRONG FOUNDATION FOR FUTURE ACADEMIC AND LIFE SUCCESS AND INSTILLED A LOVE FOR LEARNING IN 25O+ PRESCHOOL AND TODDLER CHILDREN. THIS CURRICULUM IS A KINDERGARTEN READINESS EDUCATION PROGRAM FOR CURRENTLY 98% OF OUR CHILDREN ENROLLED ARE KINDERGARTEN READY. *EMPHASIZED BUILDING STRONG CHARACTER VALUES AND SOCIAL INTERACTION SKILLS WHILE ENGAGING IN SUMMER FUN FOR SUMMER CAMP PARTICIPANTS. *PROVIDED ACADEMIC, SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL ENRICHMENT TO CHILDREN PER WEEK FROM 10 AREA SCHOOLS, IN BEFORE AND AFTER SCHOOL CHILDREN PROGRAMS. ENGAGED IN FUN, SAFE PLAY IN CHILD WATCH WHILE THEIR PARENTS WERE USING THE YMCA FOR OVER 5,000 CHILDREN PER YEAR. *CONTINUED STEM (SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, AND MATH) PROGRAM IN SUMMER CAMP, BEFORE AND AFTER SCHOOL AND PRESCHOOL. THIS LEARNING INITIATIVE SEEKS TO BUILD YOUTH ANALYTICAL AND PROBLEM-SOLVING SKILLS THAT PREPARE CHILDREN FOR SUCCESS IN LIFE AND IN STEM CAREERS. *HEPA FACILITY (HEALTHY EATING AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY) IS PART OF CURRICULUM AS WELL AS EDUCATIONAL INFORMATION FOR PARENTS. HEPA ENCOURAGES CHILDREN TO MAKE HEALTHY CHOICES AT THE Y AND AT HOME. CHILDREN ALSO ENGAGE IN 30-60 MINUTES OF PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AT THE Y. *INTEGRATE 40 DEVELOPMENTAL ASSETS IN CHILDREN THAT HELPS THEM ACT IN POSITIVE WAYS, MAKE BETTER DECISIONS, BOUNCE BACK FROM DIFFICULTIES THROUGH DEVELOPMENT OF COPING SKILLS, AND ENGAGE IN RISKY BEHAVIORS LESS. OTHER YOUTH PROGRAMS: AS AN IMPORTANT PART OF THE VALPARAISO COMMUNITY, THE VALPARAISO FAMILY YMCA HAS SUPPORTED OUR MISSION T0 9,000 PROGRAM YOUTH PARTICIPANTS THROUGH OFFERING A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS FOR EVERY AGE AND INTEREST IN THE AQUATICS, SPORTS AND YOUTH FITNESS AREAS. DURING 2022, OUR YOUTH PROGRAMS: ENCOURAGED ACTIVE LIVING AND FOSTERED CONFIDENCE, CHARACTER, AND ATHLETIC SKILLS IN THE LIVES OF CHILDREN BY TEACHING: *YOUTH SPORTS *FITNESS FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILY FITNESS TO FAMILY PARTICIPANTS *HELPED TO ENSURE THE SAFETY OF CHILDREN BY TEACHING SWIMMING AND WATER SKILLS IN 2 POOLS. *MIDDLE SCHOOL SERVICE GROUP, Y TEENS TOGETHER, ENGAGED ABOUT 90 MIDDLE SCHOOLERS STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS WORKING WITH YOUTH IN OUR YMCA ARE TRAINED TO RECOGNIZE THE IMPORTANCE OF CULTIVATING POSITIVE ASSETS IN YOUTH AND INCORPORATE THIS TRAINING INTO ALL PROGRAMS. THE Y IS A LEADING VOICE ON HEALTH AND WELL-BEING. WE BRING FAMILIES CLOSER TOGETHER,ENCOURAGE GOOD HEALTH, AND FOSTER CONNECTIONS THROUGH FITNESS, SPORTS, FUN, AND SHARED INTERESTS. THIS IS PARTICULARLY IMPORTANT AS OUR NATION STRUGGLES WITH AN OBESITY CRISIS; FAMILIES STRUGGLE WITH WORK/LIFE BALANCE; AND INDIVIDUALS SEARCH FOR PERSONAL FULFILLMENT. OUR PROGRAMS ARE ACCESSIBLE, AFFORDABLE, AND OPEN TO ALL FAITHS,BACKGROUNDS, ABILITIES, AND INCOME LEVELS. IN 2022, WE PROVIDED $416,498 IN FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO PEOPLE WHO OTHERWISE WOULD HAVE FACED ECONOMIC BARRIERS TO PARTICIPATION. OUR YMCA BELIEVES IN GIVING BACK AND SUPPORTING OUR NEIGHBORS. WE HAVE BEEN LISTENING AND RESPONDING TO OUR COMMUNITY'S MOST CRITICAL SOCIAL NEEDS FOR 76 YEARS. ABOUT 16,000+ MEMBERS LEARN GROW AND THRIVE AT THE Y AND 3,500 ACTIVE OLDER ADULTS KEEP WORKING ON THEIR WELLNESS. DURING 2022, ABOUT 1500 MEMBERS A DAY VISITED THE Y SEEKING TO TAKE CONTROL OF THEIR HEALTH AND WELLNESS. SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY: OUR YMCA BELIEVES IN GIVING BACK AND SUPPORTING OUR NEIGHBORS.WE HAVE BEEN LISTENING AND RESPONDING TO OUR COMMUNITY'S MOST CRITICAL SOCIAL NEEDS FOR 76 YEARS. IN 2022, THE VALPARAISO FAMILY YMCA PROVIDED MEMBERSHIPS TO LOCAL GROUP HOMES AND HUMAN SERVICE AGENCIES. THIS ALLOWED THOSE CLIENTS, WHO CANNOT AFFORD TO PAY FULL FEE, THE OPPORTUNITY TO BUILD SPIRIT, MIND AND BODY. THE VALPARAISO FAMILY YMCA COLLABORATES WITH OPPORTUNITY ENTERPRISES, BOY AND GIRL SCOUTS, ARTHRITIS FOUNDATION, AMERICAN RED CROSS, LOCAL ROTARY AND KIWANIS CLUBS, AS WELL AS THE PORTER COUNTY COMMUNITY SCHOOL SYSTEMS, VALPARAISO UNIVERSITY, IVY TECH COMMUNITY COLLEGE, ST. MARY MEDICAL CENTER, AND THE CITY OF VALPARAISO TO PROVIDE THE BEST SERVICES TO THE PORTER COUNTY COMMUNITY. IN ADDITION TO THE ABOVE, THE VALPARAISO FAMILY YMCA IS INVOLVED IN THE FOLLOWING: *VOLUNTEERS: VOLUNTEERS PLAY AN IMPORTANT ROLE AT OUR YMCA TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THE LIVES OF OTHERS. OUR POLICY VOLUNTEERS TOTALED 20 AND OUR PROGRAM AND EVENT VOLUNTEERS TOTALED 520. *CERTIFIED SEVERAL STUDENTS AND ADULTS IN CPR AND FIRST AIDE AND LIFEGUARDING. *CONDUCTED LIVESTRONG AT THE YMCA PROGRAM SUPPORTING SURVIVORS OF CANCER. THIS PROGRAM HELPS CANCER SURVIVORS IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THEIR LIFE AND ACHIEVE THEIR HOLISTIC HEALTH GOALS. *PARTNERED WITH A NON-PROFIT HOSPITAL TO DELIVER SERVICES THAT ENHANCE MEMBER'S HEALTH AND WELLNESS ALL GEARED TOWARDS CHRONIC DISEASE PREVENTION. PRIMARY AREAS OF PARTNERSHIP: COMMUNITY AND MEMBERS RECEIVED FREE SCREENINGS FOR VARIOUS AREAS OF WHICH SEVERAL SCREENINGS RESULTED IN CRITICAL FINDINGS THAT WERE LIFE SAVING SEMINARS ON HEALTH AND WELLNESS TOPICS ALL DELIVERED BY MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS HEALTH FAIR, NUTRITION CONSULTATION, AND PHYSICIANS CONSULTATIONS *OTHER SPECIAL EVENTS INCLUDED: SENIOR DAY, CHRISTMAS MARKET, SENIOR OUTINGS, SUPPER WITH SANTA *PARTNERED WITH FOODBANK OF NORTHWEST INDIANA AND PROVIDED FOOD FOR 1,618 INDIVIDUALS AND 519 FAMILIES. *SUPPORTED 171 CHILDREN WITH HOLIDAY GIFTS, HELPING 69 FAMILIES WITH FOOD AND GIFTS AT THE HOLIDAYS *HOST EVENTS THAT STRENGTHEN FAMILY CONNECTION, SUCH AS SUPPER WITH SANTA (FEEDING 175 PEOPLE) *PROVIDED $8,000 IN SCHOLARSHIPS TO HIGH SCHOOL SENIORS TO SUPPORT ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. *HELPED CANCER SURVIVORS AND THOSE LIVING WITH PARKINSON'S DISEASE OR HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE TO MANAGE SYMPTOMS, FIND SUPPORT AND IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE.

THE CEO REVIEWS COMPARABLE DATA FOR THE OTHER OFFICERS PROVIDED BY THE NATIONAL YMCA DATABASE ON A PERIODIC BASIS.
